title: Programming Fundamentals and Cognitive Load Management Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and logical reasoning skills
context.additional_context: A program that simultaneously trains programming fundamentals and self-directed learning strategies through team-based collaborative learning, incorporating a real-time feedback system using digital tools.

learning_goals: Through four weeks of project execution, learners can explain fundamental programming concepts—arrays, conditionals, loops—with over 80% accuracy
In team activities, learners collaboratively design problem-solving strategies utilizing collective working memory effects and complete three project tasks based on these strategies
Learners systematically apply self-regulated learning strategies through learning journaling and weekly reflection activities, achieving at least 3 out of 4 points on the assessment rubric

resources: Collaborative Education Platform (Google Workspace, GitHub Classroom)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
